original: @183b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @183b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ka na ka warna pradzny'a p'a ra mi t'a s'a dha nam /
analyzed: ka na ka warna pradzny'a p'a ra mi t'a s'a dha nam /
translated: Kanakavarnapāramitā sādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma gser mdog can gyi sgrub thabs /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma gser mdog can gyi sgrub thabs /
translated: The practice of the perfection of wisdom goddess Suvarṇṇavarṇā

original: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble perfection of wisdom.

original: rang gi snying gar aom yig las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la dh'i:yig rnam par bkod pa las 'od dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar aom yig las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la dh'i:yig rnam par bkod pa las 'od dpag tu med pa /
translated: From the letter oṃ in one's heart appears a moon mandala on which is arranged the letter dhīḥ. From that appears Amitābha,

original: de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskul zhing gang na drangs nas mdun du stan sna tshogs pa la bzhugs par bltas nas /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskul zhing gang na drangs nas mdun du stan sna tshogs pa la bzhugs par bltas nas /
translated: whose light rays invite the gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas, who are then seen seated in the space in front on various seats.

original: yid kyis phyag dang / mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / bsod rnams yongs su bsngo ba dang /🔽bzod par gsol ba rnams byas te /
analyzed: yid kyis phyag dang / mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / bsod rnams yongs su bsngo ba dang / bzod par gsol ba rnams byas te /
translated: With the mind, one should make prostrations, offerings, confess nonvirtue, rejoice in virtue, go for refuge to the Three Jewels, generate bodhicitta, dedicate merit, and request forbearance.

original: de nas byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms rnams bsgoms te /
analyzed: de nas byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms rnams bsgoms te /
translated: Then one should meditate on loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de nas aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod nas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod nas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should meditate on emptiness by reciting “oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ” and so forth.

original: de nas de bzhin du skad cig gis zla ba la gnas pa'i dh'i:yig bltas la /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du skad cig gis zla ba la gnas pa'i dh'i:yig bltas la /
translated: Then, one should visualize the syllable dḥīḥ on a moon in the same way.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma ral pa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma ral pa'i cod pan can /
translated: That completely transforms into Prajñāpāramitā, who has a crown of hair.

original: zhal gcig pa phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: zhal gcig pa phyag bzhi pa /
translated: She has one face and four arms.

original: phyag gnyis chos 'chad kyi phyag rgya mdzad pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis chos 'chad kyi phyag rgya mdzad pa /
translated: Two hands are in the mudra of teaching the Dharma.

original: rin po che sna tshogs pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: rin po che sna tshogs pas brgyan pa /
translated: Adorned with various jewels,

original: gser mdog 'bar ba /
analyzed: gser mdog 'bar ba /
translated: golden in color, blazing,

original: phyag g-yon pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i autpa la sngon po bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i autpa la sngon po bsnams pa /
translated: holding in the left hand a blue lotus with the Perfection of Wisdom on it,

original: na bza' sna tshogs pa'i stod g-yog can /
analyzed: na bza' sna tshogs pa'i stod g-yog can /
translated: wearing a variegated upper garment,

original: phyag g-yas pa mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa /
translated: the right hand granting fearlessness,🔽seated in vajra posture on a red lotus and moon,

original: padma dmar po dang zla ba la rdo rje skyil krung gis bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: padma dmar po dang zla ba la rdo rje skyil krung gis bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: one should visualize Bhagavatī.

original: de nas brtan pa'i nga rgyal bya'o //
analyzed: de nas brtan pa'i nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: Then one should have the pride of being her.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i nga rgyal can gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'o //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i nga rgyal can gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'o //
translated: One who has the pride of being Bhagavatī Perfection of Wisdom is Bhagavatī Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de nas sngags dgod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sngags dgod par bya ste /
translated: Then one should arrange the mantras:

original: mgrin par aom dh'i:lce la aom ghi:rna ba dag la dzi:de nas rang gi snying gar a'a:yig dmar po las byung ba'i padma @184a * //
analyzed: mgrin par aom dh'i:lce la aom ghi:rna ba dag la dzi:de nas rang gi snying gar a'a:yig dmar po las byung ba'i padma @184a * //
translated: at the throat oṃ dhiḥ, on the tongue oṃ ghiḥ, at the ears jhiḥ, and then at one’s heart a red āḥ-letter-arisen lotus with eight petals.

original: 'dab ma brgyad pa ze'u 'bru ge sar dang bcas pa bsams la yi ge rnams dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad pa ze'u 'bru ge sar dang bcas pa bsams la yi ge rnams dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine an eight-petaled lotus with a pistil and stamens and arrange the syllables.

original: yid kyis padma'i 'dab ma dang ze'u 'bru ser po rnams la shar gyi 'dab ma la na mo /
analyzed: yid kyis padma'i 'dab ma dang ze'u 'bru ser po rnams la shar gyi 'dab ma la na mo /
translated: Mentally, on the lotus petals and the yellow pistil, on the petal in the east, namo;

original: me'i 'dab ma la bha ga wa tyee /
analyzed: me'i 'dab ma la bha ga wa tyee /
translated: on the petal in the southeast, bhagavatye;

original: lho'i 'dab ma la pradzny'a pa ra mi t'a yee /
analyzed: lho'i 'dab ma la pradzny'a pa ra mi t'a yee /
translated: on the petal in the south, prajñāpāramitāyai;

original: bden bral du aa mi ta gu n'a ye /
analyzed: bden bral du aa mi ta gu n'a ye /
translated: in the southwest, amitaguṇāya;

original: chu bdag gi 'dab ma la bha ga wa ti batstsha l'a ye /
analyzed: chu bdag gi 'dab ma la bha ga wa ti batstsha l'a ye /
translated: on the petal in the southwest, bhagavatīcakravarmiṇi;

original: rlung gi 'dab ma la sarba ta th'a ga t'a dzny'a na pa ri p'u r'a ye /🔽lus ngan gyi 'dab ma la sva tva batstsha l'a ye /
analyzed: rlung gi 'dab ma la sarba ta th'a ga t'a dzny'a na pa ri p'u r'a ye / lus ngan gyi 'dab ma la sva tva batstsha l'a ye /
translated: on the petal in the west, sarvatathāgatājñānapariśuddhe;🔽on the petal in the northwest, svāhācakravarmiṇi;

original: dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la tadya th'a aom dh'i:karni k'a yam /
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la tadya th'a aom dh'i:karni k'a yam /
translated: on the petal in the north, tadyathā oṃ;

original: shar du shru /🔽me ru ti /
analyzed: shar du shru / me ru ti /
translated: in the east, śru;🔽in the southeast, ti;

original: lho ru smri /🔽bden bral du te /
analyzed: lho ru smri / bden bral du te /
translated: in the south, smṛ;

original: chu bdag tu'i /🔽rlung du dz'a /
analyzed: chu bdag tu'i / rlung du dz'a /
translated: in the southwest, te;🔽in the west, ṭi;

original: lus ngan du ye /
analyzed: lus ngan du ye /
translated: in the northwest, dzi;🔽in the north, ye;

original: dbang ldan du sv'a h'a /
analyzed: dbang ldan du sv'a h'a /
translated: in the northeast, svāhā.

original: de bzhin du sngags kyi yi ge rnams bkod nas bzlas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags kyi yi ge rnams bkod nas bzlas so //
translated: Having thus arranged the mantra syllables, one should recite.

original: yi ge 'di rnams de bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge 'di rnams de bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine these syllables in the same way.

original: thun mtshams gsum du stong phrag brgyad ji srid zla ba drug gi bar ram yang na los de thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun mtshams gsum du stong phrag brgyad ji srid zla ba drug gi bar ram yang na los de thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In three sessions, one should recite eight thousand times for six months, or as long as one hears the retention of learning.

original: gser mdog can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: gser mdog can gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The sādhana of Suvarṇavarṇā Prajñāpāramitā is complete.
